meanings.definition: The outer boundary of a shape or area.
meanings.sent1: The perimeter of the garden is marked by a fence.
meanings.sent2: The students measured the perimeter of the playground for their math project.
meanings.sent3: The perimeter of the cake was decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, shadows lengthened along the perimeter of the field.
meanings.sent5: The security guard patrolled the perimeter of the building to ensure safety.

meanings.definition: The length of the boundary of a shape or area.
meanings.sent1: The perimeter of the swimming pool is 40 feet.
meanings.sent2: She calculated the perimeter of the square by adding all four sides.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked along the perimeter of the room, inspecting every corner.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts wandered beyond the perimeter of the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runners reached the final stretch of the perimeter, pushing towards the finish line.
